title: Carrie: How to Write Tension
author: Think Story
comment: 🍿 Want more Screenwriting Videos? Check out my playlist: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLY9KJ1cFVs7hcQCA0WMUJLQTCzmg8zcTB 🍿

This entire film is stunningly tense. It's one of the most linear films I've ever seen, very lean and focused, moving inexorably towards that finale...there's a sense of inevitability about it. It's such a strange film to watch now, given that it feels like an analogue of the phenomena of school shootings.
I honestly believe when Margaret splashed tea on Carrie it was a representation of the pig's blood that got dumped on Carrie

Great video, my man. You've earned yourself a new sub. I look forward to more of your content. This was a really strong analysis of why the climax to Carrie is so effective, both in its technical execution and in terms of how the film has developed its characters up to this point.
I wish I had kids so I could show them movies like Carrie and say things like, "This movie is going to change you as well as stay with you for the rest of your life. Buckle up buttercup."
description:
Carrie has one of my favorite tension filled movie sequences: The Prom Scene. So in this video I wanted to explore how screenwriter Lawrence Cohen and director Brian de Palma wrote tension and suspense into the script to create one of the most iconic horror scenes of all time.
